t: For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Hear*pn me, my God, as I voice my complaint; protect*ld my life from the threat of the enemy.
Hide*pn me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from*ld the plots of evildoers.
They*ln sharpen their tongues like swords and*ld aim cruel words like deadly arrows.
They*ln shoot from ambush at the innocent; they*ld shoot suddenly, without fear.
They*pn encourage each other in evil plans, they*ld talk about hiding their snares; they*ld say, “Who will see it?”
They*ln plot injustice and say, “We*ld have devised a perfect plan!” Surely*ld the human mind and heart are cunning.
But*pn God will shoot them with his arrows; they*ld will suddenly be struck down.
He*ln will turn their own tongues against them and*ld bring them to ruin; all*ld who see them will shake their heads in scorn.
All*ln people will fear; they*ld will proclaim the works of God and*ld ponder what he has done.
The*pn righteous will rejoice in the Lord*s and*ld take refuge in him; all*ld the upright in heart will glory in him!
